title: Macron says EU should deploy 'anti-coercion instrument' in response to Trump's tariff threats over Greenland
subhead: Donald Trump threatened to impose a 10% tariff from February 1 on all goods sent to the US from eight European countries. That levy would be increased to 25% on June 1 'until such time as a deal is reached for the complete and total purchase of Greenland.'

title: 'Trump, hands off Greenland!': From Nuuk to Copenhagen, thousands rally against US annexation plan
As Iranians face repression, 'inaction amounts to passive complicity'
Portugal votes in a presidential election full of uncertainty
subhead: For the first time in nearly 40 years, Portugal's presidential election is likely to be decided in two rounds, first on January 18, and then on February 1. The situation reflects a fragmented political landscape marked by the rise of the far right and the erosion of traditional parties.

title: Paris apartment collapses during party, one badly injured
subhead: The floor of the fifth-floor apartment caved in during a gathering of around 50 people on Saturday night in the French capital's 11th arrondissement, police said.

title: New York rapper A$AP Rocky makes comeback in new album, balancing fury and serenity
subhead: After an eight-year wait, the artist – and Rihanna's partner – has released his fourth album, 'Don't Be Dumb.' The varied and accomplished record features collaborations with Tim Burton, Tyler, The Creator, Doechii and Damon Albarn.

title: From Monroe to Trump: Two centuries of US interference in Latin America
subhead: From the Monroe Doctrine of 1823 to the intervention in Venezuela, Washington has dominated the American continent by force and through economic power. Faced with China's growing influence, Donald Trump has rejuvenated the notion of a 'manifest destiny.'

title: Chile declares state of emergency after wildfires force 20,000 residents from their homes

Trump invites more leaders to join Gaza 'Board of Peace'
French Response, the foreign ministry's X account for trolling disinformation
French police still hope to recover jewelry stolen in Louvre heist, top prosecutor says
EU and Mercosur sign 'historic' free trade deal

Mercosur-EU: What the trade deal contains for the agriculture, minerals and industrial sectors
Denmark's Greenlandic community worries: 'Our very existence is at stake'

Henrique Gouveia e Melo, the admiral who wants to lead Portugal
Mercosur trade deal will have uneven effects on EU countries
subhead: From Dutch ultra-productivism to Greek micro-farms, European agriculture – already weakened by climate change, animal epidemics and competition – has struggled to present a united front in response to the free trade agreement.

title: In Libya's desert, Sudanese refugees cross paths as they flee or return to their homeland
subhead: Between 350,000 and one million Sudanese refugees have arrived in Libya since the outbreak of war in April 2023. In the southern city of Kufra, refugees end up in unsanitary camps. With no prospects, some decide to return to Sudan, despite the horrors of the fighting.

title: Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
subhead: The former head of artificial intelligence research at Meta explains his decision to start a new company focused on the physical world, citing strategic differences with the American tech giant and predicting a 'third AI revolution' in the coming years.

title: Terror, the Iranian regime's last resort
Regulating social media is key to protecting young people's health
Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
